title: Purpose of %
text: The % wildcard is used with the LIKE operator to represent any sequence of characters, as a placeholder.

title: Returning all Records
text: The question asks for returning all records with the text "priority" meaning the search term can show up in the beginning, middle, or end of a word.

title: Placement of %
text: When the % is placed both in front of and behind a word we are searching for, it allows a match in case there is any text before or after the search term.

title: Matching with Other Text
text: If a % is not included, SQL will only return records that match exactly the search term. If there is other text before or after in the field, it will not return.

title: Identify the column and pattern for the LIKE clause
text: What column should be used with the LIKE operator to search for the text 'priority'?

title: Select the wildcard pattern for the LIKE clause
text: What wildcard pattern must be used to find entries that contain the word 'priority' anywhere in the text?

title: Combine column and pattern
text: Combine the chosen column and pattern to find the correct WHERE clause to return the desired results.
